title.narrative: CAPACITY OF Early Child Development (ECD) PROFESSIONALS

description.narrative: By 2021, Early Child Development (ECD) professionals (ECD center staff and mother and child health professionals) have strengthened capacity and tools to support the holistic development (physical, social, emotional, cognitive) of young children., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Cross-Sectoral Early Childhood Development, Evaluation, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Innovation, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, children between the ages 0 to 5 years are progressively cared for through quality Early Child Development (ECD) services and in protective and nurturing family environments.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, ECD professionals (ECD center staff and mother and child health professionals) have strengthened capacity and tools tosupport the holistic development (physical, social, emotional, cognitive) of young children.

description.narrative: Capacity-building was challenged as trainings went online. 179 teachers from the Early Childhood Development (ECD) centres were oriented to assist parents and maintain contact using social media channels to share lessons, engage, and organize home visits.The “Greater Investment in ECD” initiative was trialled across six provinces, with 170 local administrators and ECD staff trained on results-based budgeting - via onsite, online, and hybrid modes.114 teachers in Bangkok benefitted from trainings on how to promote reading among young children at home; and2,224 children under 5 years received a set of three books to aid early reading. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:30/01/2022
